awd_titl_txt: Industry/University Cooperative Research Activity:  Optical Methods Applied to Suspension Rheology
awd_abstract_narration: Knowledge of the orientation of suspended particles in both Newtonian           and non-Newtonian fluids subjected to flow is important to a wide range         of important processes.  These include composite materials processing           and the addition of additives to inks and paints.  This research                program will utilize two optical methods which have been recently               developed in the laboratory of the principal investigator for the               investigation of various fluid dynamics problems involving suspensions          of anasymmetric and/or deformable particles in both Newtonian and               non-Newtonian fluids.  The experimental methods involve the use of              polarimetry, or the analysis of light polarization, and small angle             light scattering.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
